hero.title: Federal Reserve Signals Slower Rate Cuts for 2026
hero.intro: The Federal Open Market Committee revealed today that while inflation is moderating, the path to a 2% target remains complex. This has immediate implications for mortgage rates and corporate borrowing costs.
hero.author: Sarah Jenkins
hero.contentLeft: The Fed's 'higher for longer' rhetoric is putting pressure on the housing market and commercial real estate sectors.
hero.contentRight:
Analysts expect only two quarter-point cuts in the next twelve months, down from the previous forecast of four.

Military spending and infrastructure stimulus are cited as factors keeping the economy 'hotter' than anticipated.

hero.title: Savings Strategies in a High-Interest Environment
hero.intro: For the first time in a generation, 'cash is king' as risk-free returns reach levels not seen since the early 2000s.
hero.author: Mark Stevens
hero.contentLeft: High-yield savings accounts are now yielding over 5% annually, providing a safe haven for capital.
hero.contentRight:
Experts suggest locking in these rates now before the central bank begins its late-2026 easing cycle.

Diversification into short-term treasuries remains a popular play.
